00137

00141 
00142    // A whole separate class just to get rid of Visual C++ warning C4407
00143    class FocusHandler:wxEvtHandler
00144    {
00145    public:
00146       void ConnectEvent(wxWindow *w)
00147       {
00148          w->GetEventHandler()->Connect(wxEVT_KILL_FOCUS, wxFocusEventHandler(FocusHandler::OnKillFocus));
00149       };
00150       void DisconnectEvent(wxWindow *w)
00151       {
00152          w->GetEventHandler()->Disconnect(wxEVT_KILL_FOCUS, wxFocusEventHandler(FocusHandler::OnKillFocus));
00153       };
00154       void OnKillFocus(wxFocusEvent &event)
00155       {
00156          return;
00157       };
00158    } mHandler;
00159 
00160    wxArrayString mChoices;
00161    wxString mOld;
00162 };

00222 
00223 class GridAx
00224 : public wxWindowAccessible
00225 {
00226 
00227  public:
00228    
00229    GridAx(Grid *grid);
00230 
00231    void SetCurrentCell(int row, int col);
00232    void TableUpdated();
00233    bool GetRowCol(int childId, int & row, int & col);
00234 
00235    // Retrieves the address of an IDispatch interface for the specified child.
00236    // All objects must support this property.
00237    virtual wxAccStatus GetChild(int childId, wxAccessible **child);
00238 
00239    // Gets the number of children.
00240    virtual wxAccStatus GetChildCount(int *childCount);
00241 
00242    // Gets the default action for this object (0) or > 0 (the action for a child).
00243    // Return wxACC_OK even if there is no action. actionName is the action, or the empty
00244    // string if there is no action.
00245    // The retrieved string describes the action that is performed on an object,
00246    // not what the object does as a result. For example, a toolbar button that prints
00247    // a document has a default action of "Press" rather than "Prints the current document."
00248    virtual wxAccStatus GetDefaultAction(int childId, wxString *actionName);
00249 
00250    // Returns the description for this object or a child.
00251    virtual wxAccStatus GetDescription(int childId, wxString *description);
00252 
00253    // Gets the window with the keyboard focus.
00254    // If childId is 0 and child is NULL, no object in
00255    // this subhierarchy has the focus.
00256    // If this object has the focus, child should be 'this'.
00257    virtual wxAccStatus GetFocus(int *childId, wxAccessible **child);
00258 
00259    // Returns help text for this object or a child, similar to tooltip text.
00260    virtual wxAccStatus GetHelpText(int childId, wxString *helpText);
00261 
00262    // Returns the keyboard shortcut for this object or child.
00263    // Return e.g. ALT+K
00264    virtual wxAccStatus GetKeyboardShortcut(int childId, wxString *shortcut);
00265 
00266    // Returns the rectangle for this object (id = 0) or a child element (id > 0).
00267    // rect is in screen coordinates.
00268    virtual wxAccStatus GetLocation(wxRect & rect, int elementId);
00269 
00270    // Gets the name of the specified object.
00271    virtual wxAccStatus GetName(int childId, wxString *name);
00272 
00273    // Gets the parent, or NULL.
00274    virtual wxAccStatus GetParent(wxAccessible **parent);
00275 
00276    // Returns a role constant.
00277    virtual wxAccStatus GetRole(int childId, wxAccRole *role);
00278 
00279    // Gets a variant representing the selected children
00280    // of this object.
00281    // Acceptable values:
00282    // - a null variant (IsNull() returns TRUE)
00283    // - a list variant (GetType() == wxT("list"))
00284    // - an integer representing the selected child element,
00285    //   or 0 if this object is selected (GetType() == wxT("long"))
00286    // - a "void*" pointer to a wxAccessible child object
00287    virtual wxAccStatus GetSelections( wxVariant *selections );
00288 
00289    // Returns a state constant.
00290    virtual wxAccStatus GetState(int childId, long* state);
00291 
00292    // Returns a localized string representing the value for the object
00293    // or child.
00294    virtual wxAccStatus GetValue(int childId, wxString* strValue);
00295 
00296    Grid *mGrid;
00297    int mLastId;
00298 
00299 };
